result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
(Clerked by DNeva)
Defendant Lavina M Cupp in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court calls 15CM417 & 15CM478.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Defendant pleads guilty to 15CM417.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Court dismisses and reads in 15CM478.  State relates.  Attorney Hinde relates.  Court relates and orders:

Court costs with 60 days to pay
30 days jail with 16 days credit, must report 02/23/16 by noon, Huber/work search granted
$84.28 restitution joint and several with Rosemary Hart
Apply cash bond in 15CM478 to restitution and costs

11/03/2015 MODIFIED - DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED, BUT MUST POST $200.00 CASH BOND BY THE CLOSE OF BUSINESS ON 11/16/2015. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Lavina M Cupp in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Defendant Lavina M Cupp in custody.  Rachel Payne (Kibbe) appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CM478 AND 15CM417

15CM478:  Defense moves to modify bond from a cash bond to a signature bond.  State objects to bond modification.
Court leaves bond at a $200 cash bond, but amends bond to allow defendant to be released at this time, and given until close of business on 11/16/15 to post that $200 cash.  All conditions of previous bond to remain in full force and effect.

15CM417 to track with 15CM478.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  

Must have no contact with Peter C. or Sean W. 
Must provide new address within 24 hours to the clerk of courts.
